events.description: Premiere of 'The Godfather Part III', the final part of Francis Ford Coppola's cult trilogy.
'The Silence of the Lambs' wins all major Academy Awards, including Best Picture.
Release of 'Jurassic Park' with revolutionary special effects by Industrial Light & Magic.
Tarantino's 'Pulp Fiction' revolutionizes non-linear storytelling.
The Coen brothers' 'Fargo' receives critical acclaim and becomes a cult classic.
Introduction of ICQ protocol, marking the beginning of instant messaging era.
Registration of Google.com domain name and start of search engine development at Stanford University.
Launch of Google search engine with revolutionary PageRank algorithm.
Creation of Napster file-sharing system, reaching peak of 80 million users.
Peak and burst of the dot-com bubble with loss of over $5 trillion in market capitalization.
Release of the first iPod by Apple with revolutionary scroll wheel.
Launch of LinkedIn - the first professional social network.
Launch of Steam platform, changing video game distribution.
Founding of Facebook in Harvard University dorm.
Launch of YouTube and upload of first video 'Me at the zoo'.
Release of Arctic Monkeys' debut album - fastest-selling in British history.
Radiohead releases In Rainbows with 'pay what you want' model.
Lady Gaga releases The Fame with hits 'Just Dance' and 'Poker Face'.
Michael Jackson's passing - end of an era in pop music.
Release of Kanye West's My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy.
Spain's World Cup victory with record number of passes per match.
Usain Bolt's triumph at London Olympics.
Alex Ferguson's retirement after 26-year career at Manchester United.
Germany's World Cup victory in Brazil with historic 7:1 score.
Golden State Warriors' first NBA championship in 40 years.
First observation of gravitational waves predicted by Einstein.
Successful human genome editing using CRISPR-Cas9.
SpaceX Falcon Heavy launch with Tesla Roadster onboard.
First image of a black hole in M87 galaxy.
Development of mRNA COVID-19 vaccine in record time.
